Articles.Content:
Any chance of this updating? It's working...but barely. Sound is on the fritz...plus the conflict with HotRockets...

I'd hate to see this mod left in the dust when it enhances the atmosphere (heh) of the game so much. Sound is one of the most neglected parts of KSP.

Any chance of this updating? It's working...but barely. Sound is on the fritz...plus the conflict with HotRockets...

I'd hate to see this mod left in the dust when it enhances the atmosphere (heh) of the game so much. Sound is one of the most neglected parts of KSP.

Yes, but it won't be any time soon. I've had a hard disk failure and am currently without a computer as a result.

Yes, but it won't be any time soon. I've had a hard disk failure and am currently without a computer as a result.

....I was about to say "get well soon" then I thought better of it. But really, good luck to you. Come back to us when you're able.
Any chance of you updating this? This is one of those little mods that gives way more immersion than it sounds (excuse the pun).

Yes, but it won't be any time soon. I've had a hard disk failure and am currently without a computer as a result.
Any chance of you updating this? This is one of those little mods that gives way more immersion than it sounds (excuse the pun).

Couldn't even be asked to look back TWO whole posts. On the same page.

would be great to have this back to .24.2 version, and when you have time, could you give a look at this post?

It comment about some 3D positional sound FX and volume. Your mod with this upgrades could be benefit.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92390-3D-positional-sound-FX-on-KSP-relative-to-camera-position-and-distance?p=1386954#post1386954

thank you!

would be great to have this back to .24.2 version, and when you have time, could you give a look at this post?

It comment about some 3D positional sound FX and volume. Your mod with this upgrades could be benefit.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92390-3D-positional-sound-FX-on-KSP-relative-to-camera-position-and-distance?p=1386954#post1386954

thank you!

Again. On the same page. It says he doesn't actually have a computer available to work on this. If you actually cared about the mod, you'd do the mod author the favor of reading the last few pages.

....doesn't hurt to bump it though. Will hopefully get picked up sometime in the future.
I personally haven't noticed anything different with this mod from 0.23 to 0.24 -under 32-bit, at least

Again. On the same page. It says he doesn't actually have a computer available to work on this. If you actually cared about the mod, you'd do the mod author the favor of reading the last few pages.

....doesn't hurt to bump it though. Will hopefully get picked up sometime in the future.

This would be good as when 0.25 is released its likely all the engines will be moved to the new engine module, making this mod no longer work at all.

I personally haven't noticed anything different with this mod from 0.23 to 0.24 -under 32-bit, at least

It'll still work the same with engines that are using ModuleEngine, but every new engine added will be using the new sound system with ModuleEngineFX, which isn't working yet. A big pass on engine effects is one of the features of 0.25, so it's likely that this version won't work with it at all. The good news is that my computer is back up and running, so I can start trying to figure out this problem again.
Yay, mod is not quite dead
.25 compatability anyone?
If I only ever was to use one "realism" mod, it would be this one. It is one of my absolute favourite mods ever.

Audio Muffler works in 0.25, but it also muffles Chatterer and/or RPM.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/49722-WIP-Audio-Muffler

- Edit:

Meh, ASE is definitely broken in 0.25.

Edited October 13, 2014 by Ph34rb0t

It seems it works with some parts and not with others on .25. During launch after passing mach 1 sound dropped as expected, but next stage was loud again, stage after quiet in space. Hoping for a update to make it work consistently the way it should. Really liked the immersiveness this gives

It seems it works with some parts and not with others on .25. During launch after passing mach 1 sound dropped as expected, but next stage was loud again, stage after quiet in space. Hoping for a update to make it work consistently the way it should. Really liked the immersiveness this gives

It's not as simple as that. All of the engines are slowly being moved over to the new fx system and there is currently no known way to make this mod work with it. That's why it hasn't been updated in a while.
dang, that does explain why engines behave differently though. I'll give Audio Muffler a shot

As raidernick said, 0.25 included a large pass on engine effects, updating them to use the new system. I've had some success with supporting it, but it's still buggy, and doesn't yet work with dual-mode engines such as the RAPIER. I'm going to break it down and see if I can single out what is working or not.

As raidernick said, 0.25 included a large pass on engine effects, updating them to use the new system. I've had some success with supporting it, but it's still buggy, and doesn't yet work with dual-mode engines such as the RAPIER. I'm going to break it down and see if I can single out what is working or not.

Sounds cool. I'm looking forward to using this mod.
Sounds REALLY cool. Looking forward to getting the update. Good luck and thanks.
Looking forward to using this mod for quite a while, hope you manage to make it work since it adds so much immersion with the audio effects. Cheers
Also looking forward to this mod working again. Good luck!
Hopefully, this mod will work again. It's highly immersive and thus a must have.
Is there a problem with the mod, or does it just need a recompile???

Is there a problem with the mod, or does it just need a recompile???

Sound effects that use the new FX system aren't affected, I think it's the system the rapier and NASAL parts use. Basically it's inconsistent.
